alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Franklin; Union (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 2:31AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF FRANKLIN COUNTY IN SOUTHEASTERN INDIANA, UNION AND FAYETTE COUNTIES IN EAST CENTRAL INDIANA THROUGH 315 AM EST... At 231 AM EST, a strong thunderstorm was located 10 miles west of Greensburg, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Connersville, Batesville, Brookville, Liberty, West College Corner, Oldenburg, Glenwood, Lake Santee, Salem, Waterloo, Blooming Grove, Columbia, Metamora, Bunker Hill, Brownsville, Laurel, Cedar Grove, Mount Carmel, Dunlapsville and Whitewater State Park. This includes I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 145 and 148. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
